answers.answer: I was induced with #1 and it wasn't too bad. The worst is having to be hooked up to a monitor and that getting in the way of walking around. If you can walk do it. I had pitocin with #2 and those contractions hurt like heck. Bring a stress ball to squeeze. That helped me. Good luck

I was induced 8 years ago was not expecting at all, was a regular checkup...had preeclampsia. They made me wait til 4cm then gave me epidural.It worked great for me and lasted the whole labor and some after. I had a mean nurse lol who had the monitor wrong so she wasnt seeing my contractions so before the epidural it was painful bc i was having them back to back, iv was up to high. She finally realized it and lowered it.so after epidural i was on cloud nine and just like lets do this! :)
Wow, I hope to get an epidural fast. Do they break your water first to see if you will dilate more on your own..... then pitocin.

On a Thursday nite they inserted something in me to get labor started cantbremember what it was called. I was in labor all night until i realized what was going on lol and then friday morning hooked up to iv and got things started. I had my baby at 504 pm that friday. But it went by fast to me.
I got a shower that morning before goinf in delivery and theyre assuming water broke then and i didnt even know it had.
I have been 1.5 centimeter dialted last week at my appointment. Not sure if there is any improvement.
Well good luck hun hope everything goes smoothly for you!

question: I am due today and being induced tomorrow night." I already know to eat before going in". Can you tell me how was your experience? What should I expect and any tips? How soon after the pitocin is administered can I get the epidural? NERVOUS FTM . THANKS IN ADVANCE!
title: HELP! I need some experienced ladies feedback (INDUCTION)
